textBox.richText: A few years ago I saw this guy on a news broadcast as a suspect in a hate crime. My first thought was, of course he did it - he’s so proud of his ideology he tattooed it on his forehead! Unfortunately, most perpetrators of hate crimes, members of hate groups and participants in hate speech are not so clearly labeled. A couple weeks ago a man in my apartment building was murdered, beaten and left on the railroad tracks, because he was gay. A number of years ago I had a transgender student who was killed in a homophobic rage. A middle school student near my hometown was shot execution-style by another student for being gay. These are not experiences I researched; they are events that are tangential to my life. I don’t understand how people are threatened by homosexuality. It doesn’t hurt my life or my marriage or my daughter in any way - how does it hurt others? Why is it so scary? Obviously, homosexuals are not the only targets of hate crimes, speech or language. My multi-ethnic students could have told hundreds of times they or a friend or family member dealt with bald-faced prejudice. My former student and teacher’s aide, David Armstead, is helping me put together information for those hurt by hate, students and teachers. The topic page is located here: Hate, and the first page with content is News of Hate. Please email me with ideas of sites to add. Thank you.
Hate Speech, Hate Groups, & Hate Crimes
